intro: Hieracium bracteolosum, commonly known as the bracteolus hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium bracteolosum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its resilience to environmental stress.
